result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thaddeus Thomas Foley

records.addlTxt: Letter of "not eligible" from Public Defender

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
1:03 PM Defendant Thaddeus Thomas Foley in court.  Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  DE wished to resolve the matter today but Court advises matter is not in a position to be resolved today and it is a felony and a waiver of prelim and arraignment need to be held first.  DE wishes to have counsel.  DE has not contacted the PD's office.  Recess at 1:07 PM.  Back on the record at 1:33 p.m.  Appearances remain the same.  DE does not qualify for PD representation.  Recess at 1:33 p.m.  Back on the record at 1:44 p.m.  Court reviews financial information.  Court finds conditionally indigent.   Court appoints Attorney Peter Masana, 128 2nd Avenue, Baraboo, WI 53913 (608) 448-4109 @$100/hr and reimbursement @ $75.00/month commencing November 1, 2022, directly to the Sauk Co. Clerk of Courts. DE updates address.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Return date scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on November 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on November 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
